page.title: 10Marston's Haulage Business.
page.content: {Mr.Derek Marston}has had a haulage business at Heath Holding,Halfway House,for thirteen years.Once he employed six drivers,but since the recession he's done his own mainten- ance and employs two men for his two lorries,each with a carrying capacity of twenty five tonnes. Most of his work is connected with agriculture.The lorries move poultry, grit from Halkyn,bricks from Butting- ton,concrete for silage pits,timber from Welshpool,stone from local quarries,steel buildings from Westbury and pig meal. Marston's will take anything,anywhere in the country.Once they moved a {complete farm}to Cornwall,and recently a{narrow boat}from Liverpool to the canal at Welsh Frankton.The lorries are so high up that most of our class could walk uderneath them.
